D:/GDA/gda-trunk/users/scripts/Running_and_stopping_scripts.py

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 # scripts:
00002 
00003 # scripts you write are saved in this demo in a local folder on your computer
00004 #       you can have several scripts open for editing at once
00005 #       output goes to the "Scripting Terminal"
00006 
00007 
00008 # if you want to run a script, press the run button.  If there are any syntax errors, then the script will not run.
00009 # But if you have any namespace errors (you try and call an object or variable which does not exist) then
00010 # an error will not occur until that point on the script (a limitation of all scripting languages), so be careful!
00011 
00012 # if you want to run several script one after the other, then you can create a queue of scripts.  
00013 # To add a script to the queue, open the script up in the editor and press the "Add to queue" button
00014 # You start the queue from the "Queue scripts tab"
00015  
00016 # To stop a script, press the "Stop All" button in the Jython Terminal tab.  Closing the GUI will not stop the 
00017 # script as it will be running on the GDA server, and not inside the GUI.  Pressing this button will stop the 
00018 # immediately.  This may leave more complex scripts in an unknown state.
00019 
00020 # To ensure stop scripts cleanly (i.e. in a helpful place in the script, when you know no work is being done),
00021 # use the pause command.
00022 
00023 # then if you use the "pause script" and "halt script" buttons on the Jython Terminal tab, you know where
00024 # in you script it is pausing and stoping.
00025 
00026 # run this script to demonstrate the buttons:
00027 
00028 for i in range(20):
00029         print i
00030         Thread.sleep(500) # stops the script for 500 milliseconds
00031         pause
